inclusion.criterion: Blood donors will be enrolled from among participants in the blood programs of the National Institutes of Health/Clinical Center/Department of Transfusion Medicine (NIH/CC/DTM) and the American Red Cross/Central Maryland Chapter/The Greater Chesapeake and Potomac Regional Blood Services (ARC).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Enrollment will be restricted to those who test positive in the anti-HCV screening assay.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The donor must be anti-HCV+ at the time of donation or otherwise be identified as having acute hepatitis C virus infection (Or, b) Have HBV infection as evidenced by the presence of HBsAg and/or HBV DNA with or without coexistent HCV infection.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The donor must be 18 years of age or older.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The donor must be able/willing to travel to NIH for blood sampling 4 times in the first year of study and semi-annually thereafter and willing to have an annual history and physical examination.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The donor must be willing and able to provide informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Donors who do not consent or who do not meet eligibility criteria will be excluded from the study with appropriate explanation.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has a history of HCV and recent coinfection with HBV, but no other significant medical conditions. He is on treatment for HCV and has a negative biopsy for hepatocellular carcinoma.
